content.description: 3rd route from left at north side wall.  Starts in mini dihedral to a good rest, then follows layback crack/flake to top.
content.location: see Blue Lukegoon for north side location

content.description: This is the furthest right route on the north side wall.  Climb great pockets to thin crux near top.
content.location: see Blue Lukegoon for north side wall location.

content.description: Left of Dust in My Gun. Scramble up from belay to ledge where you can stand on a block and clip first bolt. Start here or down climb and get full value. Might be wise to stick clip 2nd bolt..... Different character than most of the climbing in the canyon.Â
content.location: Left of Dust In My Gun

content.description: This route is 5th from left or 2nd from right at the north side wall.  Climbs great pockets to small roof crux area.  Awesome rock!
content.location: see Blue Lukegoon for north wall location.

content.description: 2nd route from left at the north side wall.  Climb good rock for a couple of bolts that leads to lower angle climbing. Once you get to good ledge route gets steep again and more tricky climbing.  Route goes a little right off the ledge then back left.
content.location: look for north side NS directions in Blue Lukegoon description.

content.description: this route is 4th from left at the north side wall.  Climbs pocketed face to roof.  Trend left at roof to crack/flake.  Follow to top.
content.location: see Blue Lukegoon for north side wall location

content.description: Furthest route to the right on the North Wall. mellow start to consistant climbing to the anchor. 12 draws?
This route is on the north side wall.  Climb up blocky rock to access the sweet blue streak.  Climb up pretty good holds, trends right towards top.  Shade all day.
content.location: North side wall is down canyon past the big bend.  Look up to your right for the blue streak.  Trail starts below wall.

content.description: The North Wall is becoming one of the best cliffs for moderates near Rapid City. Fun routes on great stone. Gets shade most of the day although you may deal with some sun if you get there early in the morning, especially around the summer solstice.
